alert.note: Alert for Eastern Plymouth; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:42PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A slow-moving strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Plymouth and north central Bristol Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Halifax, or near Bridgewater, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Torrential downpours could lead to localized minor street flooding. Locations impacted include... Brockton, Plymouth, Taunton, Bridgewater, Marshfield, Middleborough, Easton, Pembroke, Rockland, Duxbury, Whitman, Hanover, East Bridgewater, Raynham, Kingston, Carver, Lakeville, Norwell, Hanson and Halifax. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
